connector.description:
Send data to an FTP server.

In the header, you can set the `file` / `ce-file` property to specify the filename to upload.

If you do not set the property in the header, the Kamelet uses the exchange ID for the filename.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionHost.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionHost
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionHost.description: The hostname of the FTP server.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionPort.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionPort
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.connectionPort.description: The port of the FTP server.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.username
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.username.description: The username to access the FTP server.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.password
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.password.description: The password to access the FTP server.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.passiveMode.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.passiveMode
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.passiveMode.description: Specifies to use passive mode connection.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.fileExist.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.fileExist
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.fileExist.description: How to behave in case of file already existent.

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.binary.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.binary
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.binary.description: Specifies the file transfer mode, BINARY or ASCII. Default is ASCII (false).

camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.autoCreate.name: camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.autoCreate
camel.kamelet.ftp-sink.autoCreate.description: Automatically create the directory the files should be written to.
